TITLE: Italy's Draghi looks to reopen schools, says vaccines only way out of COVID-19 crisis
DESCRIPTION: The Italian government will let younger students return to school next month, even if they are in coronavirus hotspots, but a broader relaxation of curbs will depend on infection rates, Prime Minister Mario Draghi said on Friday.

TITLE: Czech parliament extends government's extra powers as COVID-19 slowly recedes
DESCRIPTION: The Czech parliament on Friday extended a state of emergency giving the government extra powers to fight the COVID-19 epidemic until April 11.

TITLE: Germany issues COVID travel warning for France, Austria, Czech Republic, Denmark
DESCRIPTION: Germany warned its citizens on Friday not to make unnecessary trips to neighbouring France, Austria, Denmark and the Czech Republic because of rising COVID-19 infection rates.

TITLE: France tightens classroom closure protocols in high COVID risk regions
DESCRIPTION: France will send a school class home once one COVID-19 infection is detected among its pupils, instead of three previously, in regions under tighter coronavirus restrictions, the education minister said on Friday.

TITLE: French minister tells UK: you can't use COVID-19 vaccine 'blackmail'
DESCRIPTION: French Foreign Minister Jean-Yves Le Drian said on Friday Europe would not let itself be subjected to "a kind of blackmail" by Britain over supplies of COVID-19 vaccines.

TITLE: AstraZeneca vaccine safe to use while potential rare effects probed: WHO
DESCRIPTION: The AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine is still recommended for use while studies continue to examine any potential link to "very rare" side effects including blood clots, a senior World Health Organization (WHO) official said on Friday.

TITLE: Volunteers break rank to raise doubts in trial of Russia's second COVID-19 vaccine
DESCRIPTION: Some of those who volunteered for the clinical trial of Russia's second COVID-19 vaccine have broken rank and taken part in go-it-alone "citizen experiments" which they say raise concerns about the shot's efficacy.

TITLE: Canada needs stricter health measures to counter rapid spread of COVID-19 variants - officials
DESCRIPTION: COVID-19 variant cases are increasing rapidly in several parts of Canada and longer-range forecasts show that stronger public health restrictions will be required to counter the spread of the disease, health officials said on Friday.

TITLE: 'No light at the end of the tunnel' - The COVID-19 battle in one French hospital
DESCRIPTION: Anesthetist Caroline Tesse cannot say whether the third wave of COVID-19 infections sweeping across France will peak in three weeks or three months. But she does know that it is too late to prevent the virus from overwhelming her intensive care unit.

TITLE: Serbia starts COVID-19 vaccinations at migrant camps
DESCRIPTION: Serbia began vaccinating its migrant population on Friday to curb the coronavirus from spreading in refugee camps where social distancing is a challenge.

TITLE: Volunteers break rank to raise doubts in trial of Russia's second COVID-19 vaccine
DESCRIPTION: Some of those volunteering in a trial of Russia's second COVID-19 vaccine have broken rank and conducted go-it-alone amateur "citizen experiments" that they say raise concerns about the shot's efficacy.

TITLE: Turkey starts initial talks to procure Russia's Sputnik-V vaccine
DESCRIPTION: Turkey has begun initial talks to procure the Sputnik-V vaccine from Russia, Health Minister Fahrettin Koca said on Thursday, adding Ankara would receive a total of 100 million doses of COVID-19 vaccines from various suppliers by the end of May.

TITLE: Amazon starts on-site COVID-19 vaccination for U.S. employees
DESCRIPTION: Amazon.com Inc is rolling out on-site COVID-19 vaccination for its U.S. front-line employees, it said on Thursday, as companies step up efforts to get their workers immunized against the coronavirus.

TITLE: Iraq gets first shipment of AstraZeneca vaccines via COVAX
DESCRIPTION: Iraq received 336,000 doses of AstraZeneca's COVID-19 vaccine on Thursday, the first sent there under the global COVAX vaccine-sharing scheme.

TITLE: Venezuela business group proposes directly buying 6 million vaccines
DESCRIPTION: Venezuela's largest business organization on Thursday presented a proposal to buy 6 million COVID-19 shots to vaccinate private sector workers and families, a plan that would require the approval of the government of Nicolas Maduro.

TITLE: Chile locks down capital Santiago despite world's fastest vaccination rate
DESCRIPTION: Chilean health officials on Thursday extended a lockdown across the capital Santiago to tame a second wave of infections even as the South American nation continues to plow ahead with the world's fastest per capita vaccination campaign.

TITLE: Greece lifts week-long quarantine for vaccinated Israeli tourists
DESCRIPTION: Greece on Thursday lifted a one-week quarantine rule for Israeli travellers who are vaccinated against COVID-19 and test negative, the civil aviation authority said.

TITLE: France puts region around Lyon under tighter COVID restrictions
DESCRIPTION: Three additional French regions including the Rhone department around the city of Lyon will be put under tightened COVID-19 restrictions for four weeks, the government announced on Thursday.

TITLE: Biden sets goal of 200 million U.S. COVID-19 shots in his first 100 days
DESCRIPTION: U.S. President Joe Biden said on Thursday he was setting a new goal of administering 200 million doses of COVID-19 vaccine in the United States in his first 100 days in office.

TITLE: EU export restrictions on COVID shots would be 'lose-lose' situation: Pfizer executive
DESCRIPTION: European Union export restrictions on COVID-19 vaccines would result in a 'lose-lose' situation for everyone, including EU members, a Pfizer executive said, a day after the bloc tightened oversight of shot deliveries beyond its borders.

TITLE: Oxford to test inhaled version of COVID-19 vaccine with 30 volunteers
DESCRIPTION: Oxford University said on Thursday it was launching a study to investigate immune responses of a nasal administration of its COVID-19 vaccine developed with AstraZeneca, with 30 health volunteers aged 18 to 40 for the initial trial.

TITLE: Government action can still save summer, European airlines say
DESCRIPTION: European governments can still salvage the summer tourist season despite COVID-19 vaccine setbacks and resurgent infections, if they take joint action on digital health passes and travel rules, airline chief executives said on Thursday.

TITLE: Austria warns of harm to EU if vaccine spread within bloc not adjusted
DESCRIPTION: Austria's Chancellor Sebastian Kurz warned on Thursday that the European Union would be greatly harmed if COVID-19 vaccines were not distributed more equitably between member states.

TITLE: Mexico to speed up vaccine rollout, fearing risk of new COVID-19 wave
DESCRIPTION: Mexico will accelerate its rollout of COVID-19 vaccines to protect the public against any new wave of infections, President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador said on Wednesday as the country's pandemic death toll approached 200,000.

TITLE: Brazil passes 300,000 COVID-19 deaths, as minister pledges 1 million shots per day
DESCRIPTION: As the number of COVID-19 deaths in Brazil passed 300,000 on Wednesday, President Jair Bolsonaro's fourth health minister used his first official day in the job to pledge a vaccination goal of 1 million shots a day to put the brakes on the snowballing crisis.

TITLE: Vienna and nearby regions to reinstate coronavirus lockdown over Easter
DESCRIPTION: Vienna and two other provinces in eastern Austria will go back into lockdown for several days over Easter in a bid to ease the growing strain on intensive care wards from rising coronavirus infections, Austria's health minister said on Wednesday.

TITLE: Finland proposes home lockdown for Helsinki residents for first time during pandemic
DESCRIPTION: The Finnish government on Wednesday proposed locking down residents of five cities, including the capital Helsinki, and only allowing people to leave their homes for limited reasons, to curb rising coronavirus infections and hospitalisations.

TITLE: Merkel rejects calls for vote of confidence over handling of coronavirus pandemic
DESCRIPTION: German Chancellor Angela Merkel on Wednesday rejected demands by the opposition to ask parliament for a vote of confidence in her government over rising discontent with her handling of the coronavirus pandemic.

TITLE: Caribbean appeals to Biden to share vaccines with U.S. 'third border'
DESCRIPTION: Several Caribbean island nations have issued a plea to the United States to share its stockpile of COVID-19 vaccines with the region as it has said it would with Mexico and Canada, calling on it not to neglect its "third border."

TITLE: UK and EU say looking to create 'win-win' situation on COVID-19 vaccines
DESCRIPTION: Britain and the European Commission said they are discussing how they can work together to create a "win-win" situation on COVID-19 vaccines after the bloc threatened to take tougher measures to curb the export of deliveries of shots.

TITLE: Facebook, Twitter must do more to stop COVID-19 anti-vaxxers, U.S. states say
DESCRIPTION: Attorneys general for 12 U.S. states on Wednesday accused Facebook Inc and Twitter Inc of doing too little to stop people from using their platforms to spread false information that coronavirus vaccines are unsafe.

TITLE: Uber teams up with ScriptDrop to expand prescription delivery access in U.S.
DESCRIPTION: Pharmacies signed up with ScriptDrop will be able to use Uber's delivery services, which could result in fewer events of customers going without their prescriptions due to COVID-19 related limitations, the post said on Wednesday.

TITLE: U.S. says hopes WHO report on virus origins is 'based on science'
DESCRIPTION: The United States expects the World Health Organization (WHO) investigation into the origins of the novel coronavirus pandemic to require further study, perhaps including a return visit to China, a senior U.S. official said on Wednesday.

TITLE: COVID-19 vaccine AstraZeneca roller-coaster ride
DESCRIPTION: AstraZeneca is due to publish up-to-date results from its major U.S. COVID-19 vaccine trial, after health officials publicly criticized it for using "outdated information" to show how well the immunization worked.

TITLE: Pandemic rages in Eastern Europe leaving hospitals struggling to cope
DESCRIPTION: Hungary's hospitals are under "extraordinary" pressure from rising coronavirus infections, its surgeon general said on Wednesday, as the country became a hotspot in the third wave of a pandemic that has hit Central Europe especially hard.

TITLE: Canada's lagging COVID-19 vaccine campaign set to ramp up as virus variants spread
DESCRIPTION: Canada is expecting enough COVID-19 vaccine doses to double its supply by the end of next week to help ramp up a slow vaccination program as more contagious virus variants push the country toward a third wave of coronavirus infections.

TITLE: Science vs skeptics: some in France struggle to trust in AstraZeneca shot
DESCRIPTION: Brigitte Becker knows that her asthma leaves her vulnerable to COVID-19, but brief suspensions of the AstraZeneca vaccine in some countries over a small number of blood-clotting cases have deepened her resolve to await a different shot.

TITLE: Exclusive: India delays big exports of AstraZeneca shot as infections surge, sources say
DESCRIPTION: India has put a temporary hold on all major exports of the AstraZeneca coronavirus shot made by the Serum Institute of India (SII), the world's biggest vaccine-maker, to meet domestic demand as infections rise, two sources told Reuters.

TITLE: France may extend COVID restrictions to three other regions, including Lyon
DESCRIPTION: France may widen its COVID-19 restrictions to three other regions, including the Rhone region which houses the major city of Lyon, the government said on Wednesday, lengthening a list of high-risk zones including Paris where curbs have been tightened.

TITLE: Crisis zones disadvantaged by weak COVID-19 response, Red Cross says
DESCRIPTION: Countries hit hard by humanitarian crises have also been disadvantaged by a far weaker response to COVID-19 than wealthier states, the International Red Cross and Red Crescent Movement said on Wednesday.

TITLE: Dutch curfew, curbs extended as coronavirus infections surge
DESCRIPTION: A nationwide curfew and other curbs aimed at containing the coronavirus in the Netherlands will be extended by three weeks until late April, Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte said on Tuesday.

TITLE: Norwegian government tightens COVID measures, postpones reopening
DESCRIPTION: Norway is introducing new national measures to contain the coronavirus outbreak, including a ban on the public serving of alcohol, and will postpone the introduction of a plan to reopen society, Health Minister Bent Hoeie said on Tuesday.

TITLE: 'We don't believe in blockades,' says UK's Johnson on vaccines
DESCRIPTION: Britain would "not dream" of imposing any blockades on COVID-19 vaccines, Prime Minister Boris Johnson said on Tuesday, adding there were encouraging signs that the European Union shared the sentiment.

TITLE: Number of COVID patients in intensive care in France at highest level this year
DESCRIPTION: The number of people with COVID-19 in French intensive care units rose by 84 on Tuesday to a new 2021 high of 4,634, health ministry data showed.

TITLE: Divert military expenses to improve health and fight poverty, Vatican says
DESCRIPTION: The coronavirus pandemic should make governments realise that defence spending cannot guarantee security for their populations and should encourage them instead to divert funds to improve health care and fight poverty, the Vatican said on Tuesday.

TITLE: German hotel owners angry over lockdown as holidaymakers head to Mallorca
DESCRIPTION: German hotel owners are fuming over an extension to measures that bar citizens from going on vacation in their own country but allow them to travel abroad, as the industry struggles to survive the coronavirus lockdown.

TITLE: World gets 'failing' grade for COVID-19 preparedness, OECD says
DESCRIPTION: Tensions between Britain and the European Union over the supply of COVID-19 vaccines show how the world deserves a "failing" grade for its past efforts to prepare for unexpected shocks, OECD chief Angel Gurria said on Tuesday.

TITLE: EU to extend vaccine export curbs to cover Britain, backloading: source
DESCRIPTION: The European Commission on Wednesday will extend EU powers to potentially block COVID-19 vaccine exports to Britain and other areas with much higher vaccination rates, and to cover instances of companies backloading contracted supplies, EU officials said.

TITLE: Boston Scientific in $189 million settlement with U.S. states over surgical mesh devices
DESCRIPTION: Boston Scientific Corp agreed to pay $188.7 million to settle claims by most U.S. states that it deceptively marketed its surgical mesh devices to consumers.

TITLE: Top U.N. rights body calls for fair, affordable access to COVID-19 vaccines
DESCRIPTION: The United Nations Human Rights Council adopted a resolution on Tuesday calling for equitable, affordable access to COVID-19 vaccines and fair pricing.

TITLE: Exclusive: Pakistan buys 1 million vaccine doses from China - minister
DESCRIPTION: Pakistan has bought more than 1 million doses of Chinese Sinopharm and CanSino Biologics COVID-19 vaccines, its first purchase from any manufacturer having previously relied on donations, the government said on Tuesday.

TITLE: African countries keen on AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine: WHO
DESCRIPTION: No countries in Africa have refused the AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine due to any remaining health concerns, a senior official of the World Health Organization (WHO) said on Monday.

TITLE: Austria delays reopening restaurants as COVID-19 cases rise
DESCRIPTION: Austria has postponed the reopening of cafe, restaurant and bar terraces planned for March 27 due to rising coronavirus cases and is preparing for regions to adapt restrictions locally, the government said on Monday.

TITLE: Prague's homeless battling COVID-19 find shelter in luxury hotel
DESCRIPTION: Prague city hall has rented a luxury hotel where homeless people who contract COVID-19 can convalesce and those who come into contact with someone with the disease can isolate.

TITLE: COVAX on track to deliver 300 million COVID-19 vaccine doses by end of second quarter: WHO
DESCRIPTION: The COVAX facility has brought 30 million doses of COVID-19 vaccine to 50 countries and is on track to deliver 300 million doses by the end of the 2nd quarter but some suppliers are having "teething problems", a senior WHO official said on Monday.

TITLE: Putin raps EU official over comments on Sputnik V vaccine
DESCRIPTION: President Vladimir Putin hit back on Monday at a European Union official who said its members had absolutely no need for Russia's Sputnik V vaccine, describing the comment as strange and suggesting it was at odds with EU citizens' interests.

TITLE: Irish PM warns of 'trouble' in vaccine supply chain if EU blocks exports
DESCRIPTION: Any European Union restrictions on vaccine exports would be a "retrograde step" that could undermine the supply of raw materials for vaccine production, Irish Prime Minister Miche¨¢l Martin said on Monday.

TITLE: Italy PM Draghi will take AstraZeneca vaccine, says suspension was not a mistake
DESCRIPTION: Italy's Prime Minister Mario Draghi on Friday said he himself will take the AstraZeneca COVID-19 shot, adding he was convinced the decision to temporarily suspend the vaccine was not a mistake.

TITLE: Brazilians think COVID-19 outbreak out of control, most fear infection: poll
DESCRIPTION: Almost eight out of 10 Brazilians think the COVID-19 pandemic is out of control in their country and more than half are "very afraid" they will get infected with coronavirus, a new Datafolha poll said on Friday.

TITLE: UK PM Johnson gets his first dose of AstraZeneca vaccine
DESCRIPTION: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson received his first dose of the AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine on Friday and urged the public to do the same, saying "he did not feel a thing."

TITLE: Sarajevo struggles with record number of deaths from COVID-19
DESCRIPTION: The Bosnian capital has been hit by record number of deaths from COVID-19 in March, prompting hospitals to warn of a lack of capacity for a rising number of patients and leaving funeral homes and cemeteries at risk of being overwhelmed.

TITLE: I would take the AstraZeneca vaccine, Germany's Merkel says
DESCRIPTION: German Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Friday she would take AstraZeneca's COVID-19 shot.

TITLE: COVID-19 strikes Brazil's Congress as third senator dies
DESCRIPTION: A third senator has died of COVID-19 in Brazil, raising questions around precautions taken in the country's Congress where as many as one-in-three lawmakers has been infected with the virus devastating Latin America's largest nation.

TITLE: Greece lifts some COVID-19 restrictions to relieve lockdown fatigue
DESCRIPTION: Greece will lift some COVID-19 lockdown restrictions next week as part of a plan to gradually reopen the economy and relieve national fatigue even as its hospitals remain under severe pressure from stubbornly high infections, authorities said on Friday.

TITLE: Europe becomes first region to surpass 1 million COVID-19 deaths: Reuters tally
DESCRIPTION: Coronavirus-related deaths in the European region surpassed 1 million on Friday as vaccination efforts attempt to keep up with new variants causing a third wave of infections that could once again overwhelm hospitals.

TITLE: 'Very exciting': German tourists land in Mallorca as restrictions ease
DESCRIPTION: Excited German tourists in face masks spilled out of Mallorca airport on Friday, among the first to arrive at the popular holiday destination after Germany last week lifted quarantine requirements for travellers returning from the Balearic Islands.

TITLE: Keep using AstraZeneca vaccine, WHO urges world
DESCRIPTION: The World Health Organization (WHO) exhorted the world to keep administering AstraZeneca's COVID-19 shots on Friday, adding its endorsement to that of European and British regulators after concerns over blood clotting.

TITLE: Russia delivers Sputnik V vaccine to St Petersburg after shortage problems
DESCRIPTION: Russia delivered on Friday the first batch of its Sputnik V coronavirus vaccine to St Petersburg since late February after shortage problems prompted the city to partially suspend its vaccination efforts.

TITLE: Mexican president thanks Biden for COVID shots to ease shortage
DESCRIPTION: Mexico's president thanked his U.S. counterpart Joe Biden on Friday for agreeing to provide 2.7 million COVID-19 vaccines to help offset a shortfall in its inoculation drive.

TITLE: Italians who refuse AstraZeneca shot can wait for different vaccine: adviser
DESCRIPTION: Italians who decline to be inoculated against COVID-19 with the AstraZeneca vaccine will be given an alternative later on, the head of the health panel advising the government said on Friday.

TITLE: Swiss postpone plans to lift COVID-19 restrictions
DESCRIPTION: Switzerland has postponed plans to relax its COVID-19 restrictions, the government said on Friday, citing increasing coronavirus cases and insufficient progress on vaccinations.

TITLE: Pause in AstraZeneca rollout was right thing to do: Irish official
DESCRIPTION: Ireland did the right thing in pausing its rollout of the AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine to protect confidence in the vaccine programme, Ireland's Deputy Chief Medical Officer Ronan Glynn said on Thursday.

TITLE: Czech government extends pandemic restrictions on movement, no date for easing
DESCRIPTION: The Czech government has agreed to extend restrictions on movement among districts beyond March 21 until further notice as the coronavirus pandemic ebbs slowly, Health Minister Jan Blatny said on Thursday.

TITLE: Bulgaria to resume vaccinations with AstraZeneca's shots
DESCRIPTION: Bulgaria will resume inoculations with the AstraZeneca vaccine from Friday after the European drug regulator said the benefits of the COVID-19 vaccine outweigh any potential risks, the head of the Bulgarian Medicines Agency said on Thursday.

TITLE: Spain to resume use of AstraZeneca's coronavirus vaccine on Wednesday
DESCRIPTION: Spain will resume administering AstraZeneca's coronavirus vaccine from next Wednesday, Health Minister Carolina Darias said on Thursday.

TITLE: Paris goes into lockdown as COVID-19 variant rampages
DESCRIPTION: France imposed a month-long lockdown on Paris and parts of the north after a faltering vaccine rollout and spread of highly contagious coronavirus variants forced President Emmanuel Macron to shift course.

TITLE: Oxford welcomes EU, UK regulator backing for COVID-19 vaccine
DESCRIPTION: Oxford's vaccine trial chief on Thursday welcomed statements by European and British medical regulators that the COVID-19 shot the university developed with AstraZeneca should continue to be rolled out after reports of blood clots.

TITLE: EU's drug regulator backs AstraZeneca vaccine after safety investigation
DESCRIPTION: The EU's drug watchdog said on Thursday it is still convinced the benefits of AstraZeneca's COVID-19 vaccine outweigh the risks following an investigation into reports of blood disorders that prompted more than a dozen nations to suspend its use.

TITLE: Italy reports 423 coronavirus deaths on Thursday, 24,935 new cases
DESCRIPTION: Italy reported 423 coronavirus-related deaths on Thursday against 431 the day before, the health ministry said, while the daily tally of new infections rose to 24,935 from 23,059 the day before.

TITLE: France reports 4,246 COVID-19 patients in intensive care, new 2021 high
DESCRIPTION: The number of people in intensive care units in French hospitals with COVID-19 rose by 27 to 4,246, the highest so far this year, the health ministry reported on Thursday.

TITLE: U.S. to share 4 million doses of AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine with Mexico, Canada
DESCRIPTION: The United States plans to send roughly 4 million doses of AstraZeneca's COVID-19 vaccine that it is not using to Mexico and Canada in loan deals with the two countries, yielding to requests to share vaccines with allies.

TITLE: More than half of all adults in England have had first COVID vaccine
DESCRIPTION: More than half of all adults in England have had their first COVID-19 vaccine, the health service said on Thursday, after a bumper 708,927 first and second shots were distributed on Wednesday.

TITLE: Fake batch of Sputnik V vaccine seized in Mexico, Russian wealth fund says
DESCRIPTION: Authorities in Mexico have seized a batch of fake doses of Russia's Sputnik V vaccine, the Russian Direct Investment Fund, which is responsible for exports of the COVID-19 vaccine, said on Thursday.

TITLE: Chile's red-hot inoculation drive reaches frozen continent of Antarctica
DESCRIPTION: Chile's blazing fast vaccination program has reached the icy shores of Antarctica, officials and researchers told Reuters on Wednesday, bringing a sense of relief to one of the most isolated and vulnerable outposts on Earth.

TITLE: Fewer AstraZeneca COVID vaccines available than UK planned for, says BBC
DESCRIPTION: Britain faces a reduction in the amount of COVID-19 vaccines because there are fewer AstraZeneca shots available than was expected, and this supply difficulty is more significant than earlier ones, the BBC reported on Wednesday.

TITLE: UK says vaccine supply is lumpy after letter warning of significant shortfall
DESCRIPTION: Britain¡¯s supply of coronavirus vaccines is ¡°lumpy¡±, health minister Matt Hancock said on Wednesday after a letter warned there would be a significant reduction in the amount of vaccine available from March 29.

TITLE: Reassuring evidence does not link AstraZeneca shot to blood clots, English medical official says
DESCRIPTION: There is a lot of reassuring evidence that suggests there is no increased risk of blood clots from AstraZeneca's COVID-19 vaccine, England's deputy chief medical officer said, adding he expected the European Medicines Agency to agree.

TITLE: France has biggest one-day jump in coronavirus cases since second lockdown in November
DESCRIPTION: France saw the biggest one-day jump in coronavirus cases on Wednesday since its second lockdown in November and the government prepared to further tighten limits on people's movement.

TITLE: UK's speedy COVID-19 vaccine rollout hit by supply cut
DESCRIPTION: Britain will see a significant reduction in the amount of COVID-19 vaccines available at the end of the month due to a cut in manufacturing supply, it said on Wednesday, in a setback to one of the world's fastest inoculation rollouts.

TITLE: Syria to get first deliveries of COVAX vaccines within weeks: WHO official
DESCRIPTION: Syria will take delivery within weeks of its first COVID-19 vaccines from the global vaccine sharing platform COVAX, allowing it to kick off its national inoculation programme as early as next month, the U.N. health agency's country head said on Wednesday.

TITLE: Germany sticks to coronavirus vaccine goal despite AstraZeneca pause
DESCRIPTION: Germany is sticking to its goal of offering a coronavirus vaccination to everyone by the end of the summer, a government spokeswoman said on Wednesday despite its decision this week to suspend use of AstraZeneca doses due to safety worries.

TITLE: UK says more than 25 million people have had first COVID shot
DESCRIPTION: Britain said on Wednesday more than 25 million people had now received a first COVID-19 vaccination, 100 days after the first person in the country received a shot.

TITLE: Pandemic accelerates in half of the Americas, Brazil faces record cases, deaths: PAHO director
DESCRIPTION: New coronavirus cases are picking up again in half of the countries in the Americas, the Pan American Health Organization (PAHO) said on Wednesday, calling on Brazil to protect its people in the face of record infections and deaths.

TITLE: Pakistan receives 500,000 vaccine doses from China, doubling available supply
DESCRIPTION: Pakistan on Wednesday received a Chinese donation of 500,000 doses of Sinopharm vaccine, bringing the country's total supply to 1 million shots, Health Minister Faisal Sultan said.

TITLE: India frets over wastage of 'elixir-like' COVID-19 vaccines
DESCRIPTION: About 6.5% of coronavirus vaccine doses in India are going to waste, health officials said on Wednesday, urging states to manage their immunisation drives better to optimise use of what one called "this elixir-like precious commodity".

TITLE: Paralysed and in pain, Spaniard hails euthanasia law as an option
DESCRIPTION: Paralysed from the neck down after suffering a car crash at 19, Rafael Botella, now 35 and in pain, is relieved that the Spanish parliament is set on Thursday to approve a law to allow euthanasia and assisted suicide.

TITLE: UK expects EU to stand by its vaccine commitment, says PM's spokesman
DESCRIPTION: Britain expects the European Union to stand by its commitment that the bloc will not restrict vaccine exports which are under contract, a spokesman for Prime Minister Boris Johnson said on Wednesday.

TITLE: Brazil has record COVID-19 deaths as new health minister prepares for job
DESCRIPTION: Brazil on Tuesday reported a record number of COVID-19 deaths just as the country's new health minister nominee pledged to continue the controversial policies of far-right President Jair Bolsonaro, who has downplayed the severity of the disease.

TITLE: Italy's Draghi says EMA comments on AstraZeneca vaccine encouraging
DESCRIPTION: Italian Prime Minister Mario Draghi said on Tuesday the latest comments by Europe's Medicines Agency (EMA) on the AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine were encouraging.

TITLE: Paris needs more coronavirus restrictions, French PM says
DESCRIPTION: French Prime Minister Jean Castex said on Tuesday that time had come for additional coronavirus restrictions in the greater Paris region as the country enters a third wave of the COVID-19 pandemic.

TITLE: U.S. talking to several countries about extra COVID-19 vaccine: Biden
DESCRIPTION: U.S. President Joe Biden said on Tuesday the United States is in talks with several countries about who will get any extra doses of COVID-19 vaccines.

TITLE: Brazil's Bolsonaro pulls military pick for health regulator post, bolstering pandemic response
DESCRIPTION: President Jair Bolsonaro has withdrawn his pick of a retired military man for the board of Brazil's federal health regulator Anvisa, the latest indication that he is starting to take the country's worsening coronavirus pandemic more seriously.

TITLE: Recovery in UK bookings unaffected by AstraZeneca setback, airlines say
DESCRIPTION: A recovery in UK travel bookings appears undimmed by the suspension of AstraZeneca's COVID-19 vaccine elsewhere in Europe, airlines said on Tuesday, as the setback threatens to delay immunisation campaigns in affected countries.

TITLE: Mother who lost only son to rare COVID complication warns parents to look for early signs
DESCRIPTION: By the time doctors realized that Lorena Navarrete's son had a rare complication of COVID-19 that afflicts some children, it was too late to save her 16-year-old Emilio.

TITLE: I've had AstraZeneca vaccine, says Britain's Duchess of Cornwall
DESCRIPTION: Camilla, Britain's Duchess of Cornwall and wife of heir-to-the-throne Prince Charles, said on Tuesday she received the AstraZeneca shot when she had her first vaccine dose.

TITLE: Mexico expects U.S. response to AstraZeneca vaccine request on Friday
DESCRIPTION: The U.S. government is expected to respond by Friday to Mexico's request to share doses of stockpiled AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccines, a senior Mexican official said Tuesday, as Canadian authorities also seek extra doses from their southern neighbor.

TITLE: Austria's Kurz and allies seek 'correction' on EU vaccine distribution
DESCRIPTION: Austrian Chancellor Sebastian Kurz said on Tuesday he and allies from eastern Europe were pushing for the European Union to adjust the way it distributes COVID-19 vaccines after complaining it was uneven

TITLE: Germany extends tax deferral for pandemic-hit firms by three months
DESCRIPTION: Germany will extend a tax deferral scheme designed to help firms hit by the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic by a further three months, Finance Minister Olaf Scholz said on Tuesday.

TITLE: Portugal's top court rejects bill to legalise euthanasia
DESCRIPTION: Portugal's Constitutional Court on Monday rejected as unconstitutional a bill approved by parliament earlier this year to allow terminally ill patients to seek assistance from a doctor to end their lives.

TITLE: Brazil eyes July for full local production of AstraZeneca vaccine
DESCRIPTION: Brazil could begin full production of AstraZeneca Plc's COVID-19 vaccine by July if regulators allow, an official at biomedical center Fiocruz said, moving up by 100 days the timeline to produce shots without imported ingredients.

TITLE: England removes Portugal from travel red-list, lifts flight ban
DESCRIPTION: Portugal has been removed from England's travel red-list, Britain's department for transport said on Monday, adding that a ban on flights had also been lifted as it was confident the risk of importing coronavirus variants had reduced.

TITLE: Ocugen seeks to sell 100 million Indian vaccine doses in U.S. in 2021
DESCRIPTION: Ocugen Inc seeks to sell 100 million doses of India's state-backed COVID-19 vaccine COVAXIN in the United States this year, the U.S. firm's chief executive Shankar Musunuri told Reuters on Monday.

TITLE: Spain joins countries halting AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine
DESCRIPTION: Spain will stop using AstraZeneca's COVID-19 vaccine for at least two weeks, the government said on Monday, joining a growing list of European countries putting the brakes on the shot over concerns about possible side effects.

TITLE: Turkey's Erdogan says new pandemic measures not being considered as cases rise
DESCRIPTION: Turkey recorded 15,503 new coronavirus cases on Monday, the highest daily rise this year, official data showed, as President Tayyip Erdogan said no new restrictions against the pandemic would be imposed for now.

TITLE: WHO scientist says no deaths linked to COVID-19 shots, urges against panic
DESCRIPTION: The top World Health Organization scientist reiterated on Monday that there have been no documented deaths linked to COVID-19 vaccines, after several nations suspended use of AstraZeneca's shot to probe possible side-effects.

TITLE: EU regulator to meet on Thursday to discuss AstraZeneca vaccine
DESCRIPTION: The European medicines regulator said on Monday it would hold a meeting this week on the information gathered into whether the AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine contributed to thromboembolic events in those inoculated.

TITLE: 'Don't panic': WHO says safety systems working as AstraZeneca shots paused
DESCRIPTION: The World Health Organization's director general said on Monday that systems meant to protect public health were working, as several countries suspended use of AstraZeneca's COVID-19 vaccine to investigate possible side-effects.

TITLE: U.S. transport chief upbeat on summer travel as vaccines rolled out
DESCRIPTION: U.S. Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg gave an upbeat assessment about summer travel prospects on Monday as a growing number of Americans are vaccinated against COVID-19.

TITLE: Germany, Italy, France suspend AstraZeneca shots amid safety fears, disrupting EU vaccinations
DESCRIPTION: Germany, France and Italy said on Monday they would suspend AstraZeneca COVID-19 shots after several countries reported possible serious side-effects, but the World Health Organization (WHO) said there was no proven link and people should not panic.

TITLE: WHO urges world not to halt vaccinations as AstraZeneca shot divides Europe
DESCRIPTION: The World Health Organization appealed to countries on Monday not to pause vaccination campaigns after two more European nations and one in Asia joined a handful which have suspended use of AstraZeneca's COVID-19 vaccine over safety fears.

TITLE: Italy's medicines agency approves J&J's COVID-19 vaccine
DESCRIPTION: Italy's medicines agency AIFA said on Friday it has approved the use of the COVID-19 vaccine produced by Johnson & Johnson, following the green light from European drugs regulator (EMA) on Thursday.

TITLE: COVID-19 situation in Paris area extremely tense: French PM
DESCRIPTION: (This March 12th story corrects vaccination numbers in last two paragraphs)

TITLE: US, India, Australia, Japan agree to send one billion vaccines across Asia by end-2022

TITLE: France's COVID-19 cases top four million

TITLE: Factbox: What the U.S. Senate voted on in marathon COVID-19 'vote-a-rama'
DESCRIPTION: U.S. Senate Democrats were taking the first step on Thursday toward President Joe Biden's $1.9 trillion COVID-19 relief plan through passage of a budget resolution, as they voted on a series of amendments in a marathon "vote-a-rama" session that could last into the night.

TITLE: Canada to shrug off 'momentary disruptions' in vaccine supply, working closely with U.S. - Trudeau
DESCRIPTION: Canada will succeed in inoculating its population despite "momentary disruptions" in the supply of COVID-19 vaccines and is working closely with the new U.S. administration to fight the disease, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said on Thursday.

TITLE: French PM says no need for new national lockdown for now
DESCRIPTION: French Prime Minister Jean Castex said on Thursday that the coronavirus situation in France remained fragile but that for the moment there was no need for a new national lockdown.

TITLE: Explainer-How do negative interest rates work?
DESCRIPTION: Investors scaled back their bets that the Bank of England will bring in negative interest rates anytime soon after the central bank said lenders would need at least six months to prepare for such a move.

TITLE: Schumer, after Biden meeting, says Democrats united on a 'bold' COVID-19 bill
DESCRIPTION: U.S. Senate Democratic Leader Chuck Schumer, after meeting with President Joe Biden, said they were united on a big COVID-19 relief package and that Democrats would work with Republicans as possible, but offered no further details.

TITLE: Yellen calls for 'acting now - and acting big' on pandemic relief
DESCRIPTION: U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen on Wednesday said it was imperative to enact a comprehensive $1.9 trillion economic rescue package that includes $350 billion in aid to state and local governments, the Treasury said in a statement.

TITLE: Biden presses U.S. House Democrats to move ahead with COVID-19 bill: Jeffries
DESCRIPTION: President Joe Biden, in his call with U.S. House Democrats on Wednesday, made it clear to lawmakers that they need to move forward with COVID-19 relief legislation, House Democratic Caucus Chairman Hakeem Jeffries told reporters.

TITLE: Venezuela's offshore funds could pay for vaccines but Maduro not cooperating, Guaido says
DESCRIPTION: Venezuelan opposition leader Juan Guaido said on Wednesday that Venezuelan funds controlled by the U.S. Treasury Department could be used to pay for coronavirus vaccines but that President Nicolas Maduro's government is refusing to cooperate.

TITLE: 'We've lost so many': Brazil starts vaccinating Amazon river dwellers
DESCRIPTION: Health workers sped along the Amazon river this week to start vaccinating riverside communities, bringing hope to a region hard hit by COVID-19 and now facing a lethal surge driven by a new Brazilian variant of coronavirus.

TITLE: Biden said Republican proposal for $600 billion in COVID-19 aid 'way too small': Schumer
DESCRIPTION: U.S. Senate Democratic Leader Chuck Schumer said President Joe Biden told Democrats the proposal ten Senate Republicans have made for $600 billion in COVID-19 relief is "way too small."

TITLE: EU proposes production investment to remedy vaccine shortages
DESCRIPTION: The European Commission is proposing to speed up the production of COVID-19 vaccines by helping to upgrade existing pharmaceutical plants or build new ones, according to a letter seen by Reuters on Tuesday.

TITLE: Queen Elizabeth to send message of condolence to Captain Tom's family
DESCRIPTION: Britain's Queen Elizabeth will send a private message of condolence to the family of Captain Tom Moore after the record-breaking fundraiser died aged 100 on Tuesday, Buckingham Palace said.

TITLE: Factbox: Worldwide coronavirus cases cross 103.44 million, death toll at 2,236,895
DESCRIPTION: More than 103.44 million people have been reported to be infected by the novel coronavirus globally and 2,236,895 have died, according to a Reuters tally.

TITLE: Factbox: Biden's COVID-19 relief plan vs. Senate Republicans counter-proposal
DESCRIPTION: U.S. President Joe Biden has proposed a $1.9 trillion package to fight the coronavirus and help those affected by it. A group of 10 Senate Republicans has proposed a smaller $600 billion package.

TITLE: Ramaphosa welcomes first vaccines arriving in South Africa
DESCRIPTION: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa hailed the arrival of the first doses of COVID-19 vaccine on Monday as a chance to "turn the tide" on a disease that has devastated the country.

TITLE: With cheesy potato bake, French restaurant owner defies COVID rules
DESCRIPTION: Since COVID-19 restrictions forced the closure of her bistro in northern France, Kathia Boucher has been working as a cleaner, and worrying about losing her business.

TITLE: England's South Africa variant COVID cases likely linked to travellers, health official says
DESCRIPTION: Cases in England of the South African coronavirus variant, which are not directly linked to travel, probably came from people who were asymptomatic when they entered Britain rather than a broader infection, Public Health England said on Monday.

TITLE: Biden, Republicans COVID-19 meeting to exchange ideas -White House
DESCRIPTION: President Joe Biden's meeting with a group of centrist Republican senators to discuss COVID-19 federal aid later on Monday will be a "good faith" meeting to exchange ideas but the Democratic president will not be making or accepting any particular offers.

TITLE: UK need to come down hard on South African COVID variant - health minister
DESCRIPTION: Britain needs to contain the spread of the South African variant of the coronavirus by identifying new cases through mass testing in areas where cases unconnected with travel have emerged, Health Secretary Matt Hancock said on Monday.

TITLE: WHO team in Wuhan hold "good discussions" with Chinese counterparts
DESCRIPTION: A World Health Organization-led team investigating the origins of the COVID-19 pandemic on Monday visited the Center for Disease Control and Prevention in China's central region of Hubei, where the outbreak emerged in late 2019.

TITLE: Despite 'productive' Republican meeting, Biden will not accept a scaled-down COVID-19 bill -White House
DESCRIPTION: After meeting with Republican senators at the White House on Monday, President Joe Biden appeared poised to push forward with his $1.9 trillion COVID-19 relief plan even if it fails to draw Republican support.

TITLE: UK says seeks urgent answers from EU over vaccine moves
DESCRIPTION: Britain said on Friday it was urgently seeking answers from the European Union over its decision to restrict the export of COVID-19 vaccines to Northern Ireland.

TITLE: U.S. workplace safety agency issues new COVID-19 guidance for employers
DESCRIPTION: The U.S. Department of Labor office that enforces workplace safety laws on Friday encouraged employers to take additional steps to protect workers amid the COVID-19 pandemic, after unions and Democrats criticized the agency's response under former President Donald Trump.

TITLE: Canadian airlines to cancel Mexico, Caribbean flights amid vaccine shortfall
DESCRIPTION: Canada's major airlines have agreed to suspend all flights to Mexico and the Caribbean for three months starting on Sunday as the country's COVID-19 vaccine rollout suffered another setback, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said on Friday.

TITLE: Rio may throw out hundreds of COVID-19 vaccine shots after power outage
DESCRIPTION: Power outages in Rio de Janeiro may have spoiled hundreds of doses of COVID-19 vaccines, city health officials told Reuters on Friday, in a fresh setback for Brazil's hamstrung immunization efforts.

TITLE: Bolsonaro, who won't take a COVID-19 shot, vows to inoculate Brazil fast
DESCRIPTION: Brazil President Jair Bolsonaro, who says he won't take any COVID-19 shot, on Thursday vowed to quickly inoculate all Brazilians, tempering his tone after his support fell due to a patchy vaccine rollout and a brutal second wave of infections.

TITLE: U.S. House will bring budget resolution to floor next week: Pelosi
DESCRIPTION: U.S. House of Representatives' Speaker Nancy Pelosi on Thursday said the House will take its first steps next week toward passing a new coronavirus aid bill when it debates budget rules that would allow Democrats to advance a bill in the Senate without Republican support.

TITLE: Democrats vow to push ahead on Biden's coronavirus aid plan next week
DESCRIPTION: The U.S. Senate and House of Representatives will move next week on President Joe Biden's plan to deliver a fresh infusion of COVID-19 relief to Americans and businesses reeling from the pandemic, top Democrats said on Thursday.

TITLE: Australia extends New Zealand 'travel bubble' pause amid new COVID-19 cases
DESCRIPTION: Australia on Thursday extended its suspension of quarantine-free travel with New Zealand, as the Pacific Island nation investigated two new positive cases of the South African COVID-19 variant.

TITLE: Poland puts into effect new restrictions on abortion
DESCRIPTION: Poland's government put into effect on Wednesday a constitutional court decision banning terminations of pregnancies with foetal defects, as conservative policies increasingly take root in one of Europe's most devout Catholic countries.

TITLE: Britain cracks down on travel to stop virus spread
DESCRIPTION: Britain announced new measures to reduce travel in and out of the country on Wednesday, hoping that by tightening its borders it can reduce the risk of new variants of the coronavirus spreading and putting its vaccination programme at risk.

TITLE: UK airline bosses criticise hotel quarantine plan, seek support
DESCRIPTION: The bosses of airlines including British Airways, Virgin Atlantic and easyJet criticised on Tuesday a possible plan for mandatory quarantine in hotels for some or all arrivals to Britain and called for a support package.

TITLE: New coronavirus cases rise in France, third national lockdown feared
DESCRIPTION: The daily number of new coronavirus infections in France stayed above 20,000 on average for the fourth straight day on Tuesday while hospitalisations reached an eight-week high of 27,041, increasing fears of a third national lockdown.

TITLE: UK will see 'quite a lot more' COVID deaths - England's Chief Medical Officer
DESCRIPTION: Britain will see more deaths from coronavirus before a vaccination programme takes effect, England's chief medical officer Chris Whitty said on Tuesday after the country's death toll exceeded 100,000.

TITLE: UK PM Johnson: We did everything we could to minimise COVID loss of life
DESCRIPTION: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson said his government had done everything it could to minimise loss of life in the coronavirus pandemic after the country's death toll exceeded 100,000.

TITLE: Canada to unveil more steps to restrict foreign travel, provinces impatient with delay
DESCRIPTION: Canada will soon make foreign travel harder in a bid to clamp down on the coronavirus, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said on Tuesday without giving details, prompting major provinces to demand action.

TITLE: Democrats may move forward on coronavirus aid without Republicans, says Schumer
DESCRIPTION: Democrats in the U.S. Senate will move forward on U.S. President Joe Biden's coronavirus relief plan without Republican support if necessary, Senate Democratic leader Chuck Schumer said on Tuesday.

TITLE: Italy sends warning letter to Pfizer over COVID vaccine delays
DESCRIPTION: The Italian government on Monday sent a letter of formal notice to Pfizer calling on the drug company to respect its contractual commitments over its COVID-19 vaccine deliveries, the government special commissioner said.

TITLE: 'I feel divine' says Madrid care home resident after second COVID shot
DESCRIPTION: Residents of a Madrid nursing home got their second shot of the coronavirus vaccine on Monday and some began planning their first trip outside in months.

TITLE: Spain reports record 94,000 COVID-19 cases over weekend, incidence hits new high
DESCRIPTION: Spain reported a record 93,822 new coronavirus infections over the weekend, while the incidence of the virus as measured over the past 14 days jumped to a new high of 885 cases per 100,000 people on Monday from 829 cases on Friday.

TITLE: France's new COVID-19 hospitalisations and ICU treatments rise sharply
DESCRIPTION: The number of people hospitalised in France for COVID-19 rose by more than a 1,000 over the last two days, a trend unseen since Nov. 16, and the number of patients in intensive care units for the disease exceeded 3,000 for the first time since Dec. 9.

TITLE: Britain records 22,195 new COVID cases, has given 6.6 million first vaccine doses
DESCRIPTION: Britain said on Monday it had recorded 22,195 new COVID-19 cases, down from 30,004 the previous day, with government statistics showing that 6,573,570 people had received a first dose of a vaccine.

TITLE: Exclusive: AstraZeneca to supply 31 million COVID-19 shots to EU in first quarter, a 60% cut - EU source
DESCRIPTION: AstraZeneca Plc has informed European Union officials on Friday it would cut deliveries of its COVID-19 vaccine to the bloc by 60% to 31 million doses in the first quarter of the year due to production problems, a senior official told Reuters.

TITLE: New Brazil coronavirus variant found in nearly half of Amazon city cases
DESCRIPTION: A variant of the novel coronavirus already accounts for about half of new infections in the Brazilian Amazonian city of Manaus, raising concerns about a greater risk of spread, a researcher warned on Friday.

TITLE: Quotes: Britain says new COVID-19 variant may carry higher risk of death
DESCRIPTION: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson said on Friday the new English variant of COVID-19 may be associated with a higher level of mortality, though he said evidence showed that both vaccines being used in the country were effective against it.

TITLE: UK may take more action to protect borders during COVID crisis -UK PM Johnson
DESCRIPTION: Britain may have to implement further measures to protect its borders from new variants of COVID-19, Prime Minister Boris Johnson said on Friday.

TITLE: UK cannot consider easing lockdown while rates are so high - PM
DESCRIPTION: British Prime Minister said the government could not consider easing lockdown restrictions with infection rates at their current high levels, and until it is confident that the vaccination programme is working.

TITLE: Spanish officials under fire for jumping vaccine queue as COVID-19 cases surge
DESCRIPTION: A steady drip-feed of public officials admitting to having been vaccinated ahead of priority groups has sparked uproar on social media in Spain at a time when several regions are tightening restrictions in an effort to curb a spike in infections.

TITLE: France tells its citizens: Fabric masks not enough to protect from COVID
DESCRIPTION: The French government is now recommending that people wear surgical masks in public because they offer better protection from COVID-19 transmission than fabric face coverings, Health Minister Olivier Veran said on Thursday.

TITLE: Exclusive: Pfizer-BioNTech agree to supply WHO co-led COVID-19 vaccine scheme - sources
DESCRIPTION: Pfizer and BioNTech have agreed to supply their COVID-19 vaccine to the World Health Organization co-led COVAX vaccine access scheme, two sources familiar with the deal said, the latest in a series of shots to be included in the project aimed at lower-income countries.

TITLE: No way to hold Rio carnival in July, the city's mayor says
DESCRIPTION: It will not be possible to host carnival celebrations in July, Rio de Janeiro's new mayor said on Thursday, as Brazil's second wave of coronavirus infections gathers steam with vaccine supplies still scare in Latin America's biggest country.

TITLE: EU promised help to Ukraine to get coronavirus vaccine as soon as possible: Zelenskiy
DESCRIPTION: The European Union has promised to help Ukraine obtain coronavirus vaccines as soon as possible, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy's office said on Thursday evening.

TITLE: Runaway cost of oxygen tanks adds extra agony to pandemic in Mexico
DESCRIPTION: A shortage of oxygen tanks in Mexico City and a fourfold rise in prices for the life-saving gas are compounding the coronavirus crisis for the sprawling capital's hard-hit inhabitants.

TITLE: Spain's health minister to resign as COVID-19 cases hit new daily high
DESCRIPTION: Spanish Health Minister Salvador Illa will resign next week to campaign in regional elections in Catalonia, an official from his party said on Thursday, while national authorities reported a record 44,357 new daily coronavirus cases.

TITLE: Factbox: Biden's plan to fight the coronavirus
DESCRIPTION: President Joe Biden launched a comprehensive federal plan on Thursday to rein in the raging COVID-19 pandemic.

TITLE: Argentine president receives Russian-made COVID-19 vaccine
DESCRIPTION: Argentine President Alberto Fernandez received an injection of the Sputnik V coronavirus vaccine on Thursday, a day after the country's health regulator approved the Russian-made vaccine for use among those aged 60 and older.

TITLE: Spanish regional health chief resigns after jumping vaccine queue
DESCRIPTION: The top health official in the Spanish region of Murcia resigned on Wednesday after admitting he had received a coronavirus vaccine despite not belonging to any priority group designated for initial inoculations, such as frontline medical staff.

TITLE: New COVID-19 variant defeats plasma treatment, may reduce vaccine efficacy
DESCRIPTION: (This Jan. 20 story corrects to make clear bioRxiv is a website for research that has yet to be peer-reviewed, not a scientific journal)

TITLE: Backers of IP waiver for COVID-19 drugs make fresh push at WTO
DESCRIPTION: South Africa and India argued in favour of a waiver of intellectual property rights on COVID-19 drugs and vaccines at a closed-door meeting of the World Trade Organization on Tuesday but opponents showed little sign of budging, trade sources said.

TITLE: Spain's COVID-19 incidence hits new high as third wave of infection rages
DESCRIPTION: Spain's incidence of the coronavirus as measured over the past 14 days reached a new high of 714 cases per 100,000 people on Tuesday after 689 cases the previous day, Health Ministry data showed, as a rampant third wave of infection grips the country.

TITLE: China defends early actions on COVID-19 after panel report
DESCRIPTION: China on Tuesday defended its early actions taken to fight the COVID-19 outbreak, saying that it immediately notified the World Health Organization and took "the most comprehensive, thorough, strict prevention and control measures".

TITLE: Brussels targets vaccinating at least 70% of EU adults by summer
DESCRIPTION: European Union states should aim to vaccinate at least 70% of their adult populations against COVID-19 by the summer, the European Commission recommended on Tuesday.

TITLE: India urges frontline workers not to refuse vaccines as targets missed
DESCRIPTION: India appealed to frontline workers on Tuesday not to refuse vaccines for COVID-19, after almost all states failed to meet targets in the first few days of what the government calls the world's biggest immunisation campaign.

TITLE: Biden will keep Dr. Francis Collins as National Institutes of Health director: statement
DESCRIPTION: U.S. President-elect Joe Biden will keep Dr. Francis Collins as head of the National Institutes of Health, his transition team said in a press release on Friday.

TITLE: Brazil's Bolsonaro says mission to get vaccines in India will leave within three days
DESCRIPTION: Brazil's President Jair Bolsonaro said on Friday that a plane would be sent to India to pick up COVID-19 vaccines in two or three days at most, after the government had announced the flight would leave on Friday.

TITLE: Global COVID-19 death toll tops 2 million
DESCRIPTION: The worldwide coronavirus death toll surpassed 2 million on Friday, according to a Reuters tally, as nations around the world are trying to procure multiple vaccines and detect new COVID-19 variants.

TITLE: French coronavirus death toll rises to nearly 70,000
DESCRIPTION: The cumulative death toll from the coronavirus in France rose by 636 to 69,949 on Monday as the country added a three-day batch of retirement home deaths to the tally, health ministry data showed on Friday.

TITLE: Britain tightens borders to keep out new COVID-19 variants
DESCRIPTION: Britain is tightening border controls to block new variants of COVID-19, suspending all "travel corridor" arrangements that had meant arrivals from some countries did not require quarantine.

TITLE: WHO stops short of advising proof of COVID-19 shots for travel
DESCRIPTION: The World Health Organization on Friday refrained from advising proof of COVID-19 vaccination or immunity as a condition for international travel, citing "critical unknowns" regarding their efficacy in reducing transmission and limited availability.

TITLE: Brazil airlifts emergency oxygen into pandemic-struck state, vaccine drive lags
DESCRIPTION: Brazil's Air Force flew emergency oxygen supplies on Friday to the jungle state of Amazonas devastated by a resurgent pandemic and the government scrambled to organize nationwide vaccinations while President Jair Bolsonaro said he "should be at the beach."

TITLE: Canada keeps end-September COVID vaccination target despite Pfizer delay
DESCRIPTION: Pfizer's reduction of its COVID-19 vaccine shipments will not delay Canada's goal of getting most people inoculated by the end of September, the country's procurement minister said on Friday as the country battled a second surge in infections.

TITLE: Vaccine shipments to EU slow as Turkey, China ramp up inoculations
DESCRIPTION: Some EU nations are receiving fewer than expected doses of coronavirus vaccines as U.S. pharmaceutical firm Pfizer slows shipments, while Turkey and China race ahead with inoculations amid surging infections worldwide.

TITLE: Lebanese parliament passes law to pave way for coronavirus vaccine deals
DESCRIPTION: Lebanon's parliament on Friday approved a law that paves the way for the government to sign deals for coronavirus vaccines as it battles a steep increase in infections.

TITLE: China steals march on West in developing nations' vaccine rollout
DESCRIPTION: China is stealing a march on Western drugmakers in the COVID-19 vaccine race in developing nations, with Indonesia and Turkey rolling out huge campaigns with a Chinese shot this week, Brazil due to follow soon, and even EU member Hungary signing up.

TITLE: France tightens coronavirus border controls, imposes earlier curfew
DESCRIPTION: France will strengthen border controls and bring forward its night curfew by two hours to 6 p.m. for at least a fortnight as it tries to slow the spread of coronavirus infections, the government said on Thursday.

TITLE: Some vaccinated Russians offered laxer COVID-19 curbs, life without masks
DESCRIPTION: Some Russian regions are proposing to relax COVID-19 restrictions such as mandatory mask-wearing and other incentives for Russians who receive the homegrown vaccine.

TITLE: Most care home residents in Ontario unvaccinated as COVID-19 outbreaks rage
DESCRIPTION: Ontario has vaccinated only a small proportion of long-term care and retirement home residents, the group most vulnerable to COVID-19, while delivering tens of thousands of doses to healthcare workers outside of the homes, new provincial data released on Wednesday showed.

TITLE: Mexico to invoke labor rule to ensure U.S. vaccines for illegal migrants
DESCRIPTION: Mexico will invoke labor provisions in the new North American trade pact in a bid to ensure that illegal migrants in the United States receive coronavirus vaccines, the country's top diplomat said on Wednesday.

TITLE: WHO reform needed in wake of pandemic, public health experts say
DESCRIPTION: The role and remit of the World Health Organization (WHO) should be examined in the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic, and reforms will likely be needed to free it from politics and give it more independence, public health experts said on Wednesday.

TITLE: Brazil's Bolsonaro says he was right to question Chinese COVID-19 vaccine
DESCRIPTION: Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro said on Wednesday he was right to criticize the credibility of a Chinese COVID-19 vaccine developed by Sinovac Biotech that posted disappointing efficacy results in local trials.
